item.title: Stephen Colbert says CBS barred interview with Texas Democratic candidate
item.content:encoded: US late-night show host says CBS pulled interview from Monday's broadcast over fears it could violate new FCC guidance.

item.title: France arrests nine over killing of far-right activist Quentin Deranque
item.content:encoded: Quentin Deranque, 23, was beaten to death by far-left activists in France's Lyon last week.

item.title: How Jesse Jackson helped empower US Arabs and lift up the Palestinian cause
item.content:encoded: Arab American advocates eulogise Jackson as a civil rights giant who embraced their communities and defended Palestine.

item.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,455
item.content:encoded: These are the key developments from day 1,455 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

item.title: US immigration judge rejects Trump bid to deport Columbia student Mahdawi
item.content:encoded: Mohsen Mahdawi, a Palestinian student activist, faced deportation proceedings amid a protest crackdown under Trump.

item.title: Hamas: Trump’s ‘Board of Peace’ must stop Israel’s killing in Gaza
item.content:encoded: 'War of genocide against the Strip is still ongoing', Hamas says, warning the board not to act as 'cover'.

item.title: Vinicius earns Real Madrid 1-0 win at Benfica in match marred by racism row
item.content:encoded: Match interrupted for several minutes after Madrid's goalscorer Vinicius Jr accused opponent of racially insulting him.

item.title: Humanoid robots perform advanced martial arts at Chinese New Year gala
item.content:encoded: Robots perform sophisticated human movements as Beijing sends a message to the world.

item.title: Tributes pour in after US civil rights icon Jesse Jackson dies at 84
item.content:encoded: World leaders share memories of Jackson, a leader of the US civil rights movement who passed away on Tuesday.

item.title: Colombia to resume peace talks with ECG after temporary suspension
item.content:encoded: Colombia's largest criminal group paused talks after President Gustavo Petro pledged to target its leader Chiquito Malo.

item.title: Warner Bros rejects latest Paramount bid but open to ‘best and final’ offer
item.content:encoded: The Warner Bros Discovery board says it remains committed to the Netflix deal.

item.title: US and Iran reach ‘guiding principles’ in Geneva nuclear talks
item.content:encoded: The US and Iran reached an understanding on key “guiding principles” at indirect nuclear talks in Geneva.

item.title: Yemeni Americans feel ‘betrayed’ as Trump revokes immigration protections
item.content:encoded: Prominent Trump supporter Amer Ghalib says US decision to nix deportation protection for Yemenis 'very unfortunate'.

item.title: ‘Journey of hell’: Migrants in Libya endure torture, rape, forced labour
item.content:encoded: A new UN report says migrants, refugees, and asylum seekers in Libya are being forcibly rounded up and abused.

item.title: Thousands in Kosovo rally against war crimes trial of ex-KLA commanders
item.content:encoded: Special court in The Hague hears closing arguments this week in the trial of former Kosovo Liberation Army leaders.

item.title: US president’s son Eric Trump invests in drone maker with gov’t contracts
item.content:encoded: Israel's Xtend recently won US Defense Department contract, is bidding for another before merger with JFB Construction.

item.title: Sheinbaum says Mexico declines Trump’s ‘Board of Peace’ invite
item.content:encoded: Mexico's Claudia Sheinbaum said she has turned down an invitation from Donald Trump to join his “Board of Peace."

item.title: Why Israel’s annexation threatens Jordan
item.content:encoded: Israel’s plans to claim parts of the occupied West Bank as ‘state property’ is raising concerns in neighbouring Jordan.

item.title: US judge says wrongfully deported Kilmar Abrego Garcia can’t be re-detained
item.content:encoded: Judge says Trump administration has made 'one empty threat after another' to deport Salvadoran national to Africa.

item.title: Peru’s Congress votes to impeach President Jose Jeri in government shake-up
item.content:encoded: Jeri is the latest in a series of Peruvian presidents to be removed from office by an act of Congress.

item.title: ‘I’ve heard nothing but great things,’ LeBron James says of Israel
item.content:encoded: Backlash came swiftly for basketball star LeBron James after saying he’s heard “nothing but great things” about Israel.

item.title: Who should control our digital world?
item.content:encoded: A few tech corporations control most of the world's data. Some countries have been fighting to change that.

item.title: Tarique Rahman sworn in as Prime Minister of Bangladesh
item.content:encoded: Bangladesh is marking a historic new chapter as Tarique Rahman is sworn in as Prime Minister.

item.title: US kills 11 people in three strikes on alleged drug-trafficking vessels
item.content:encoded: President Donald Trump's campaign against alleged drug boats has resulted in at least 145 deaths since September.

item.title: Deadly explosion rocks Russian military site near St Petersburg
item.content:encoded: Russian media report at least three people killed when the military police facility in Sertolovo collapses after blast.
